width="72"/&gt;&lt;/entry&gt;&lt;entry&gt;&lt;id&gt;tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-3947691530317823276.post-2613012269000165004&lt;/id&gt;&lt;published&gt;2019-01-22T10:54:00.000-08:00&lt;/published&gt;&lt;updated&gt;2019-05-19T10:18:57.599-07:00&lt;/updated&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="NetApp"/&gt;&lt;title type='text'&gt;Modernizing a NetApp Certification &lt;/title&gt;&lt;content type='html'&gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-gQ5UOhsxcgk/XEYvykxKUJI/AAAAAAAAVTc/BOoGpW1hHqExjB04Z2kvwPeELu5Fi1vBQCLcBGAs/s1600/idw-image-2.png&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;400&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;400&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;320&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-gQ5UOhsxcgk/XEYvykxKUJI/AAAAAAAAVTc/BOoGpW1hHqExjB04Z2kvwPeELu5Fi1vBQCLcBGAs/s320/idw-image-2.png&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;320&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;i&amp;gt;Read on to find out how new versions of NetApp exams are written during an Item Development Workshop at NetApp&amp;#39;s RTP office&amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;In mid-October, this message popped up in the NetApp United Slack channel from Petya Stefanova, NetApp United&amp;#39;s fearless leader:&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;i&amp;gt;Hey @channel there’s a new opportunity to participate in an IDW with NetAppU. This time the workshop will be reviewing the two exams for NetApp Certified Data Administrator ONTAP (NCDA, NS0-192) and NetApp Certified Support Engineer ONTAP (NCSE ONTAP, NS0-590), taking place mid-end January. If you are interested, drop me an email how you quality and can contribute to IDW. I need to submit nominations by Friday. So please let me know ASAP! Partners and customers can participate&amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;I immediately knew that it was something that I would be interested in, so I talked to my employer to get their approval and put in my application. At the time, I didn&amp;#39;t have any NetApp certifications so I didn&amp;#39;t expect to be selected to take part in the process.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;A couple of weeks after that, I traveled to Las Vegas for Insight 2018 where I decided to take the NCSE and NCSE-OS exams. If I was in the running for participating in the IDW, I figured I might as well take the exam so that I could have some insight into the exam itself. As luck would have it, I passed and now was the proud owner of two new NetApp certifications.&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;A few weeks after Insight wrapped up, I was greeted one morning by an email from Brandi Einhorn, an Evaluation Manager for NetApp University - I was in for the NCSE-OS item development workshop!&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;color: #3d85c6; font-size: x-large;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;Day 0&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;I flew in on Sunday night and got to RTP at around 5:30PM or so. I immediately met up with some other NetApp United members for dinner and drinks. Great to finally meet some more NetApp United folks! We called it a night pretty early though since we had work to do in the morning.&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MBjk8iWec2k/XEY7n4fVQkI/AAAAAAAAVT8/F4HQMPa_LYYHg0Sr7NimFYMtLxJi38VFwCLcBGAs/s1600/20190113_223736.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;777&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;310&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MBjk8iWec2k/XEY7n4fVQkI/AAAAAAAAVT8/F4HQMPa_LYYHg0Sr7NimFYMtLxJi38VFwCLcBGAs/s640/20190113_223736.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;color: #3d85c6; font-size: x-large;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;Day 1&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;I arrived at NetApp&amp;#39;s RTP office at around 8:30 and got to meet Brandi in person (Brandi, if you&amp;#39;re reading this, it was great to meet you!). We were also introduced to a psychometrician from a company called Mensor. What is a psychometrician, you ask? I wondered the same thing, and learned that it is someone who is an expert at the science of the psychological components of exams.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GA9MpJa-YhE/XEdC_Yn0D1I/AAAAAAAAVWE/aAYaxKfaotk4faOh0x1TdIwelBK-1N9jgCEwYBhgL/s1600/20190114_083138.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GA9MpJa-YhE/XEdC_Yn0D1I/AAAAAAAAVWE/aAYaxKfaotk4faOh0x1TdIwelBK-1N9jgCEwYBhgL/s640/20190114_083138.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;After getting to know the other IDW participants, we learned about the concept of the &amp;quot;minimally acceptable candidate (MAC)&amp;quot; who was the target audience for the exam, and asked to put ourselves in their shoes when designing exam questions. From there, we reviewed the existing exam objectives and then performed a technical review of the current bank of questions for the NCSE-OS, using the following criteria:&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-x_uF1rTlcTc/XEdB3VJZ2qI/AAAAAAAAVV4/SD39LawKI0UsmHXjPQ2OJR-o-BNCUzRgQCLcBGAs/s1600/image_65a7efc2-7a79-450e-8fe7-67ddbc7c3ca220190119_084505%2B%25281%2529.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1478&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1108&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-x_uF1rTlcTc/XEdB3VJZ2qI/AAAAAAAAVV4/SD39LawKI0UsmHXjPQ2OJR-o-BNCUzRgQCLcBGAs/s640/image_65a7efc2-7a79-450e-8fe7-67ddbc7c3ca220190119_084505%2B%25281%2529.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;478&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;Based on this review, some questions were retained as they are still relevant in ONTAP 9.5 and some were retired since they were no longer relevant. We then decided on the importance of each exam objective category, which determined the number of questions per objective. Once this review was complete at the end of the day, we were left with 10-11 questions per IDW participant to write the following day.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;color: #3d85c6; font-size: x-large;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;Day 2&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;We began Day 2 by writing each exam objective up on the board and the number of questions we needed to write for it, and then put our initials next to the ones that we felt we were capable of writing. Immediately, I was struck by the realization that, as a friend put it, &amp;quot;learning to write a good cert test is more difficult than taking a hard cert test&amp;quot;. I found it VERY challenging to develop a new question from scratch while maintaining the rules of congruence, relevancy, difficulty and so on. I made a goal for myself to write one good question per hour. Luckily, I was surrounded by some very smart people who gave me some pointers on how to phrase questions/distracters so that they fit into the guidelines.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;By some miracle, I was able to finish my questions by the end of the day, and then we were treated to a dinner out with both IDW groups at the Angus Barn. It was a great time and a really good way to blow off some steam after another day of hard work.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6jD8l5Sp40g/XEdHwWJd6SI/AAAAAAAAVWQ/m4ta_0ksx7EXlsjZbFFqiG9VZjUzamNCACLcBGAs/s1600/image_74cacb5d-c2a3-4b40-800d-73e62c9ef60b20190119_084445.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1478&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1108&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6jD8l5Sp40g/XEdHwWJd6SI/AAAAAAAAVWQ/m4ta_0ksx7EXlsjZbFFqiG9VZjUzamNCACLcBGAs/s640/image_74cacb5d-c2a3-4b40-800d-73e62c9ef60b20190119_084445.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;478&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-sCXiEBwf3kU/XEdIMtiEnXI/AAAAAAAAVWY/-Gj73p82uwkMbb8gz20aN9CavgrUlm2tACLcBGAs/s1600/20190115_213049.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-sCXiEBwf3kU/XEdIMtiEnXI/AAAAAAAAVWY/-Gj73p82uwkMbb8gz20aN9CavgrUlm2tACLcBGAs/s640/20190115_213049.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;i&amp;gt;I&amp;#39;m starting to sense a pattern here. Maybe my Wisconsin drinking habits are rubbing off on them?&amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;color: #3d85c6; font-size: x-large;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Day 3&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;Our primary objective was to review all of the new questions that were written following the same set of guidelines that were laid out in the initial technical review of the existing questions. This was the time when your fellow IDW participants had the chance to tear apart your question from a technical/grammar perspective and also share what they thought the answers were. The challenging part was that we were limited to four minutes of discussion per question - if we couldn&amp;#39;t come to a consensus within 4 minutes, the question needed to be reworked. I figured if I got even one question in without needing rework, I would consider the day a success. In the end, I think I got two of ten approved without further rework.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;color: #3d85c6; font-size: x-large;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Day 4&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;As we didn&amp;#39;t do any revisions of rejected questions during yesterday&amp;#39;s session, so now was our chance to polish up the wording on those questions that didn&amp;#39;t quite make the cut or correct technical errors/inconsistencies. Once revised, the rejected questions were reviewed again for all of the aforementioned criteria as well as a clearly documented reference for the correct answer to each question.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;After the day&amp;#39;s activities wrapped up, we were treated to a tour of the Executive Briefing Center, which is designed to accommodate meetings with customer executive teams to talk about their challenges and how NetApp fits into the solutions.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-aU5Ez2f8sm8/XEdNBxJxGSI/AAAAAAAAVWo/qQCe3TzFjeQKa8RdmRjNYToC00le7nj0wCLcBGAs/s1600/20190117_164010.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-aU5Ez2f8sm8/XEdNBxJxGSI/AAAAAAAAVWo/qQCe3TzFjeQKa8RdmRjNYToC00le7nj0wCLcBGAs/s640/20190117_164010.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;During the tour, there were a couple of statistics provided by the folks there that I found to be really impressive. The close rate of deals that come into the EBC is 89% (!!) and an EBC visit reduces the sales cycle by 43%. Really cool stuff, and I appreciated the tour.&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tWMLB5PKcg4/XEdOHNom5TI/AAAAAAAAVW0/nO3e4yvvyMQdOr9V2yL3sAJGWbfRwgDAwCLcBGAs/s1600/20190117_164116.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tWMLB5PKcg4/XEdOHNom5TI/AAAAAAAAVW0/nO3e4yvvyMQdOr9V2yL3sAJGWbfRwgDAwCLcBGAs/s640/20190117_164116.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;color: #3d85c6; font-size: x-large;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;Day 5&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;As the IDW began to draw to a close, we still had a couple tasks yet to perform. One of them was an exercise where we had 20-30 seconds to decide whether we thought the MAC would be able to get the question right as well as determine the difficulty on a scale of 1-3. This data will be aggregated and used to determine the &amp;quot;cut score&amp;quot;, or the minimum percentage a MAC must get correct in order to earn the certification. After some last-minute grammar/syntax corrections, everything was set in stone and my first IDW came to a close.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;color: #3d85c6; font-size: x-large;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Final Thoughts&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;span style=&amp;quot;color: #3d85c6; font-size: x-large;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;Participating in the IDW was one of the coolest things I&amp;#39;ve done in my career, honestly. I am so honored that NetApp would consider my contributions to the certification process valuable enough to invite me to RTP for the workshop. It was also a tremendous opportunity to meet new friends (of which there were many) and see old friends. If you&amp;#39;re reading this and you are presented with the opportunity to take part in one of these, DO NOT pass it up! It&amp;#39;s a solid week of hard work, but there is a lot of fun to be had as well. I can only hope I&amp;#39;ll be invited to another one some day.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;Special thanks to the following people:&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/PeytStefanova&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@PetyaStefanova&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; - for your recommendation&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/BrandiEinhorn&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@BrandiEinhorn&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; - for organizing the workshop&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/WelshMatador&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@WelshMatador&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; - for teaching us Welsh slang - tidy!&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/hybriddatacentr&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@HybridDataCentr&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; - for graciously offering to drive everywhere and talking about smoked meats&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/tmacmd&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@tmacmd&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; - for your experience in writing great questions and the ride to the airport&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/pappa24&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@pappa24&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; - for making sure we Americans know all about MetroCluster&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/SpindleNinja&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@SpindleNinja&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; and &amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/infrachatting&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@infrachatting&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; - for many good discussions over drinks as always&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/NetApp&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@NetApp&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; and &amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/NetAppU&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@NetAppU&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; for the accommodations&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1bu484eWy_Y/XEdR3K5PFOI/AAAAAAAAVXA/-M-evMRVRRQIYJag_PRqsPuRUwSVsTyqwCLcBGAs/s1600/image_from_ios.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1bu484eWy_Y/XEdR3K5PFOI/AAAAAAAAVXA/-M-evMRVRRQIYJag_PRqsPuRUwSVsTyqwCLcBGAs/s640/image_from_ios.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&lt;/content&gt;&lt;link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='https://www.blogger.com/feeds/3947691530317823276/posts/default/2613012269000165004'/&gt;&lt;link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='https://www.blogger.com/feeds/3947691530317823276/posts/default/2613012269000165004'/&gt;&lt;link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='https://www.langhq.com/2019/01/modernizing-netapp-certification.html' title='Modernizing a NetApp Certification '/&gt;&lt;author&gt;&lt;name&gt;Donny Lang&lt;/name&gt;&lt;uri&gt;http://www.blogger.com/profile/04332684287885880604&lt;/uri&gt;&lt;email&gt;<span class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="4f21203d2a3f23360f2d232028282a3d612c2022">[email&#160;protected]</span>&lt;/email&gt;&lt;gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='32' src='//1.bp.blogspot.com/-JafglNogKoE/WsfNRWPGLRI/AAAAAAAAOwA/ct7A0f4IRrMkD4AQSqkjb4FXdWMmsSSYgCK4BGAYYCw/s49/2018-04-06%2B14_39_55-Donny%2BLang%2B%2528%2540DonnyLang1%2529%2B_%2BTwitter.png'/&gt;&lt;/author&gt;&lt;media:thumbnail xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/" url="https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-gQ5UOhsxcgk/XEYvykxKUJI/AAAAAAAAVTc/BOoGpW1hHqExjB04Z2kvwPeELu5Fi1vBQCLcBGAs/s72-c/idw-image-2.png" height="72" width="72"/&gt;&lt;/entry&gt;&lt;entry&gt;&lt;id&gt;tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-3947691530317823276.post-9189143576057770081&lt;/id&gt;&lt;published&gt;2018-10-31T10:51:00.000-07:00&lt;/published&gt;&lt;updated&gt;2018-10-31T10:51:22.779-07:00&lt;/updated&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Blogtober"/&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Blogtober2018"/&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="NetApp"/&gt;&lt;title type='text'&gt;NetApp Insight 2018 Trip Report, Part 2&lt;/title&gt;&lt;content type='html'&gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nJ8iysM9IVk/W9nchDcRdoI/AAAAAAAAUG4/7U-iHWgJ2uknopdL6UmXE2_uTbW1wddQgCLcBGAs/s1600/18net-social-tease-1024x512.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;400&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;160&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nJ8iysM9IVk/W9nchDcRdoI/AAAAAAAAUG4/7U-iHWgJ2uknopdL6UmXE2_uTbW1wddQgCLcBGAs/s320/18net-social-tease-1024x512.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;320&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;Welcome back to the continuation of my trip out to NetApp Insight 2018 (read &amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://www.langhq.com/2018/10/netapp-insight-2018-trip-report-part-1.html&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Part 1&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; if you haven&amp;#39;t yet)! I&amp;#39;m going to pick back up at the beginning of the third day of the conference, which began with the morning General Session.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;Day 3&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;Similar to Tuesday, there was a Wednesday morning General Session that featured some interesting customer stories as well as several product demos. The ones that stood out to me in particular were the NetApp Kubernetes Service announcement which likely comes as a result of the StackPoint acquisition and the demo of NetApp Data Availability Services (NDAS). Again, I won&amp;#39;t go into super deep detail about the Wednesday General Session since you can watch it on YouTube&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MJdvp9eiB4A&amp;quot;&amp;gt;here&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;, but it was really cool to see how easy it was to deploy applications and services from Cloud Central.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fphUO-kqciM/W9neuba7HqI/AAAAAAAAUHE/HPN1sFWaqN8ZTMrZT1m2he88l9O2tpoDgCLcBGAs/s1600/20181024_074643.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fphUO-kqciM/W9neuba7HqI/AAAAAAAAUHE/HPN1sFWaqN8ZTMrZT1m2he88l9O2tpoDgCLcBGAs/s640/20181024_074643.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TKulaU7vXs/W9nftG-Fw_I/AAAAAAAAUHQ/t4AUNK6bPEsGbR7NY7CtlyzodP4mbJL0QCLcBGAs/s1600/20181024_080110.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TKulaU7vXs/W9nftG-Fw_I/AAAAAAAAUHQ/t4AUNK6bPEsGbR7NY7CtlyzodP4mbJL0QCLcBGAs/s640/20181024_080110.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;i&amp;gt;I had one of my Tweets show up on the big screen before the General Session; I think I&amp;#39;m famous now&amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;I thought Dave Hitz&amp;#39;s speech at the end of the session was a nice cap to the second General Session of the conference too. His speaking style makes it hard to not get excited about whatever he is talking about. My favorite quote? &amp;quot;Graphical user interfaces are for WIMPS!&amp;quot; Haha, sorry NetApp UX designers!&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hBh-1Y52oIU/W9niMBwxqnI/AAAAAAAAUHc/jHuvEtSRex4UFMQhQngUm838_W2plnXaACLcBGAs/s1600/20181024_095738.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hBh-1Y52oIU/W9niMBwxqnI/AAAAAAAAUHc/jHuvEtSRex4UFMQhQngUm838_W2plnXaACLcBGAs/s640/20181024_095738.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-BXpfUBE4Jn8/W9ninJtB6nI/AAAAAAAAUHk/2pXG35fZJCwWjQ_lqm7Pepac9URa0tQmwCLcBGAs/s1600/20181024_100230.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-BXpfUBE4Jn8/W9ninJtB6nI/AAAAAAAAUHk/2pXG35fZJCwWjQ_lqm7Pepac9URa0tQmwCLcBGAs/s640/20181024_100230.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;I was a little lighter on sessions on Wednesday because I spent more time at Insight Central hanging out at the Social Media Hub and talking to some vendors and folks at the NetApp booths. I also sat the NetApp Certified Support Engineer - ONTAP Specialist exam on Wednesday afternoon, which I passed! Passing the certification allowed me access into the Tech Elite Meetup that happened immediately before the Customer Appreciation Event, which was a really good time too.&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UBYEe8gkfVI/W9noALYKQ3I/AAAAAAAAUH0/sf6NvDkxrWwBSfOUv_zEy8MRPmbC0ctKgCLcBGAs/s1600/2018-10-31%2B12_34_46-desktop-7ba2004%2540ad%2B-%2BAnyDesk.png&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;748&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;556&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UBYEe8gkfVI/W9noALYKQ3I/AAAAAAAAUH0/sf6NvDkxrWwBSfOUv_zEy8MRPmbC0ctKgCLcBGAs/s640/2018-10-31%2B12_34_46-desktop-7ba2004%2540ad%2B-%2BAnyDesk.png&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;474&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;Final Thoughts&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;If I leave a conference feeling mentally exhausted after being bombarded with new information for days on end, I consider that a good experience. Being around groups of incredibly smart people always refreshes my motivation to learn more and be a better engineer. Not to diminish the sessions because they were responsible for feeding me lots of new knowledge, but the people I had the privilege to meet (too numerous to list here) had the bigger impact.&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Finally, I want to give a big thank you to &amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://blog.netapp.com/welcome-to-the-new-netappunited-2018-team/&amp;quot;&amp;gt;NetApp United&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; for creating a community that I am proud to be a part of, and it was great to meet fellow members!&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div style=&amp;quot;text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Thanks for reading and I&amp;#39;ll be back to Insight in 2019!&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&lt;/content&gt;&lt;link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='https://www.blogger.com/feeds/3947691530317823276/posts/default/9189143576057770081'/&gt;&lt;link src='//1.bp.blogspot.com/-JafglNogKoE/WsfNRWPGLRI/AAAAAAAAOwA/ct7A0f4IRrMkD4AQSqkjb4FXdWMmsSSYgCK4BGAYYCw/s49/2018-04-06%2B14_39_55-Donny%2BLang%2B%2528%2540DonnyLang1%2529%2B_%2BTwitter.png'/&gt;&lt;/author&gt;&lt;media:thumbnail xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/" url="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nJ8iysM9IVk/W9nchDcRdoI/AAAAAAAAUG4/7U-iHWgJ2uknopdL6UmXE2_uTbW1wddQgCLcBGAs/s72-c/18net-social-tease-1024x512.jpg" height="72" width="72"/&gt;&lt;/entry&gt;&lt;entry&gt;&lt;id&gt;tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-3947691530317823276.post-6798440429166982087&lt;/id&gt;&lt;published&gt;2018-10-30T13:01:00.001-07:00&lt;/published&gt;&lt;updated&gt;2018-10-30T13:17:01.115-07:00&lt;/updated&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Blogtober"/&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Blogtober2018"/&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="NetApp"/&gt;&lt;title type='text'&gt;NetApp Insight 2018 Trip Report, Part 1 &lt;/title&gt;&lt;content type='html'&gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o-6hx0NRFYg/W9ezAxr_9-I/AAAAAAAAUDs/xhVQxwqxIowvNP0FNJk31cwzuxn2EFvQQCEwYBhgL/s1600/18net-social-tease-1024x512.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;512&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1024&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;200&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o-6hx0NRFYg/W9ezAxr_9-I/AAAAAAAAUDs/xhVQxwqxIowvNP0FNJk31cwzuxn2EFvQQCEwYBhgL/s400/18net-social-tease-1024x512.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;400&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;If you haven&amp;#39;t heard of NetApp Insight, it is NetApp&amp;#39;s yearly conference that is held in the US in Las Vegas (and in Barcelona in December, although sadly I will not be at that one!). It&amp;#39;s a great place to meet and talk to people not only in the NetApp organization, but also other partners and customers that are likely trying to solve the same problems that you are.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;This was my second time at Insight US - I went in 2017 as well - and this year didn&amp;#39;t disappoint. There were a lot of cool announcements, both for new products that are now available and for existing products that are continually seeing product development updates.&amp;amp;nbsp; Here are some highlights:&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;Day 1 (October 22nd)&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-yBNmmFlAqQQ/W9iFj3uVnmI/AAAAAAAAUEA/ncO4krnkQ78udf4ysEzdrHztsiQ6oDlxQCLcBGAs/s1600/20181022_083714.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;400&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-yBNmmFlAqQQ/W9iFj3uVnmI/AAAAAAAAUEA/ncO4krnkQ78udf4ysEzdrHztsiQ6oDlxQCLcBGAs/s400/20181022_083714.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;300&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;Once I got checked in on Monday morning, I hit up a couple of sessions right away. By far the coolest session of the day was the one by Skottie Miller, Technology Fellow at DreamWorks Animation. His session was all about how DreamWorks Animation uses NetApp technologies to produce all of their movies and animated series (and has, in fact, for over 20 years).&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-InGa23UCoFY/W9iH47VjCfI/AAAAAAAAUEU/K3nrs-O3L1s0pYtCh27qOBtIXLFGsi3tQCEwYBhgL/s1600/20181022_142119.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-InGa23UCoFY/W9iH47VjCfI/AAAAAAAAUEU/K3nrs-O3L1s0pYtCh27qOBtIXLFGsi3tQCEwYBhgL/s640/20181022_142119.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;I was very impressed by the level of detail in the presentation, which included lots of neat in-depth information about the CG production process and really illustrated how much hard work goes into these productions. He shared lots of technical information as well about their NetApp environment and how they use it to enable their render farm to perform over 200,000 jobs per day.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8yfPjJ4EOJw/W9iH46plWWI/AAAAAAAAUEY/QlWLPAIjNtwRoZJFDSi7q3qgZ4RmNgGsACEwYBhgL/s1600/20181022_134808.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8yfPjJ4EOJw/W9iH46plWWI/AAAAAAAAUEY/QlWLPAIjNtwRoZJFDSi7q3qgZ4RmNgGsACEwYBhgL/s640/20181022_134808.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;The thing that left a lasting impression on me was the feeling that Mr. Miller had a powerful command over not only his storage environment, but also the business processes and challenges that the NetApp infrastructure helped solve. It motivated me to endeavor to understand more about the processes at my workplace to better serve the businesses&amp;#39; needs with the infrastructure that I am responsible for managing.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;After a day of sessions, it was time to blow off a little steam with the NetApp A-Team Beer &amp;amp;amp; Bacon Social event. This ended up being a perfect opportunity to mingle with and meet some of my fellow NetApp United team members as well as the NetApp A-Team. Plus, who doesn&amp;#39;t love beer and chocolate-covered bacon?&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1nGwQsa1eAY/W9iKAyzjKbI/AAAAAAAAUEk/DOra344LRFYYvsfETR3Tl-tPwwLDmrubACEwYBhgL/s1600/20181022_195030.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1nGwQsa1eAY/W9iKAyzjKbI/AAAAAAAAUEk/DOra344LRFYYvsfETR3Tl-tPwwLDmrubACEwYBhgL/s640/20181022_195030.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;Day 2 (October 23rd)&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/u&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;Day 2 started for me (after breakfast, of course) with the Tuesday morning keynote, starting with a statement by the NetApp CEO, George Kurian. I won&amp;#39;t go into great detail on the keynote overall as it was streamed live (you can find it on YouTube &amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_i08imn4wiE&amp;quot;&amp;gt;here&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;amp;nbsp;if you&amp;#39;d like to watch it in its entirety). The story and future of the Data Fabric was featured heavily and there were several product demos for NetApp Cloud Central, Cloud Volumes, Cloud Insights, ActiveIQ, and more.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-l5lnglqwU-0/W9iO9UsOJtI/AAAAAAAAUEs/zakotwpeK64fWfgHY1ck_Y8OrKzKpOb8QCLcBGAs/s1600/20181023_084244.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-l5lnglqwU-0/W9iO9UsOJtI/AAAAAAAAUEs/zakotwpeK64fWfgHY1ck_Y8OrKzKpOb8QCLcBGAs/s640/20181023_084244.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hZOjJmuef1g/W9iP2fc0XtI/AAAAAAAAUE0/Nj78zyH96yMsOZAPzRUQ4P14QYUMHo4_wCLcBGAs/s1600/20181023_084631.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hZOjJmuef1g/W9iP2fc0XtI/AAAAAAAAUE0/Nj78zyH96yMsOZAPzRUQ4P14QYUMHo4_wCLcBGAs/s640/20181023_084631.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;After the keynote wrapped up, I attended a few more sessions, including one of the &amp;quot;birds of a feather&amp;quot; sessions, which was a panel of NetApp A-Team members - Paul Stringfellow (&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/techstringy&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@techstringy&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;), Glenn Dekhayser (&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/gdekhayser&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@gdekhayser&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;), Jason Benedidic (&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/jabenedicic&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@jabenedicic&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;), Paula Silva (&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/paula_maria&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@paula_maria&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;) and moderated by Mark Carlton (&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/mcarlton1983&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@mcarlton1983&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;). This was a really cool session for me because it gave the panel members an opportunity to tell stories about their experiences with the Data Fabric and how they helped their customers overcome the challenges surrounding their data. I also got some valuable feedback on my question about how to tackle the challenge of better internal awareness within other business units on the capabilities of our infrastructure, whether it be on-prem or in the cloud. The answer, if you&amp;#39;re curious, was to be more involved in the business processes to understand the proper technology solution and strive to be included early on in the business initiative. A big thank you to them for taking the time to have a good discussion about the topic.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-qlPkcCwOgxQ/W9iSDmkNS2I/AAAAAAAAUFA/EexJwZ11UUoPate9-iun2oPhear_rT5WwCEwYBhgL/s1600/20181023_135550.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-qlPkcCwOgxQ/W9iSDmkNS2I/AAAAAAAAUFA/EexJwZ11UUoPate9-iun2oPhear_rT5WwCEwYBhgL/s640/20181023_135550.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-LNDPZGGqVJ0/W9iSD1qzJPI/AAAAAAAAUFE/IANRuqHDSYgCNsv103z4ogdPbj-5ck94QCLcBGAs/s1600/20181023_145830.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-LNDPZGGqVJ0/W9iSD1qzJPI/AAAAAAAAUFE/IANRuqHDSYgCNsv103z4ogdPbj-5ck94QCLcBGAs/s640/20181023_145830.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;I also got a chance to attend Justin Parisi&amp;#39;s (&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://twitter.com/NFSDudeAbides&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@NFSDudeAbides&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;) session on new features that we can look forward to in ONTAP 9.5. A couple of cool things:&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;SnapMirror Synchronous (SM-S) was announced&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt; - provides ability for zero-RPO replication for mission-critical workloads. Oracle transaction logs seem to be a good use case for this.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;New networking stack&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt; - ONTAP 9.5 will introduce support for L3 routing via the magic of BGP rather than relying on L2 protocols. I wonder if we&amp;#39;ll see LIF migration to the cloud down the road?&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;NDAS (NetApp Data Availability Services)&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt; - enabling backups from secondary storage locations to the cloud. I feel like this would be a good fit for dev/test workload use cases.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;All in all, really cool stuff and awesome to see that while there is a large focus on the Data Fabric, ONTAP still sees a ton of improvements as well.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-j26eAXCPDjo/W9i3TFhXoxI/AAAAAAAAUFY/M3h1H-FA25whgtfr8CL0gxLQHg4595uwACLcBGAs/s1600/20181023_154206.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;1200&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;480&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-j26eAXCPDjo/W9i3TFhXoxI/AAAAAAAAUFY/M3h1H-FA25whgtfr8CL0gxLQHg4595uwACLcBGAs/s640/20181023_154206.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;I&amp;#39;m going to split my Insight 2018 experience into two parts to keep them relatively short and easy to read, so keep an eye out (hopefully later today or tomorrow) for Part 2 which will cover Day 3 of the conference and my final thoughts.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;Thanks for reading!&lt;/content&gt;&lt;link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='https://www.blogger.com/feeds/3947691530317823276/posts/default/6798440429166982087'/&gt;&lt;link rel='self' Lang&lt;/name&gt;&lt;uri&gt;http://www.blogger.com/profile/04332684287885880604&lt;/uri&gt;&lt;email&gt;<span class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="8ae4e5f8effae6f3cae8e6e5ededeff8a4e9e5e7">[email&#160;protected]</span>&lt;/email&gt;&lt;gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='32' xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/" url="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o-6hx0NRFYg/W9ezAxr_9-I/AAAAAAAAUDs/xhVQxwqxIowvNP0FNJk31cwzuxn2EFvQQCEwYBhgL/s72-c/18net-social-tease-1024x512.jpg" height="72" width="72"/&gt;&lt;/entry&gt;&lt;entry&gt;&lt;id&gt;tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-3947691530317823276.post-1046207921995104425&lt;/id&gt;&lt;published&gt;2018-10-26T17:10:00.000-07:00&lt;/published&gt;&lt;updated&gt;2018-10-26T17:10:44.496-07:00&lt;/updated&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Blogtober"/&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Blogtober2018"/&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="NetApp"/&gt;&lt;title type='text'&gt;NetApp Cloud Insights Preview, Part 4: Troubleshooting&lt;/title&gt;&lt;content type='html'&gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rfD0KJC_ihc/W9OitJl85jI/AAAAAAAAUC4/uzyp2XPcMOAvGIN3CcRup90FZCwxdUiIQCLcBGAs/s1600/Screenshot_2018-10-26-16-35-46.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;542&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;959&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;362&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rfD0KJC_ihc/W9OitJl85jI/AAAAAAAAUC4/uzyp2XPcMOAvGIN3CcRup90FZCwxdUiIQCLcBGAs/s640/Screenshot_2018-10-26-16-35-46.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Thank you for tuning in once again to my blog series on NetApp Cloud Insights. If you haven&amp;#39;t seen the previous entries, here are some links:&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://www.langhq.com/2018/09/netapp-cloud-insights-preview-part-1.html&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Part 1 - Installing the Acquisition Unit&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://www.langhq.com/2018/10/netapp-cloud-insights-preview-part-2.html&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Part 2 - Queries, Annotations, and Performance Policies&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://www.langhq.com/2018/10/netapp-cloud-insights-preview-part-3.html&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Part 3 - Applications &amp;amp;amp; Dashboards&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;In this post, I&amp;#39;m going to cover a really straightforward troubleshooting workflow that you can do within Cloud Insights to help you zero in on the root cause of some VM latency.&amp;amp;nbsp; We&amp;#39;ll start by searching for an asset (a VMware virtual machine in this case) from the search bar at the top of the Cloud Insights dashboard.&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-h2zRaMXkhg8/W9OltKo7SkI/AAAAAAAAUDE/33S9P9HGS34pXew1awmz23YZnXcTzg9dQCLcBGAs/s1600/Screenshot_2018-10-26-18-36-42.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;725&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;288&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-h2zRaMXkhg8/W9OltKo7SkI/AAAAAAAAUDE/33S9P9HGS34pXew1awmz23YZnXcTzg9dQCLcBGAs/s640/Screenshot_2018-10-26-18-36-42.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;We can see a bit of increased latency beginning at approximately 12:00AM that we want to take a look at. On the right-hand side of the screen, Cloud Insights has identified other objects that it believes are correlated with the asset in question. The top correlated object, for example, is the VMware datastore where the VM is located. If we click the checkbox next to the datastore asset, it&amp;#39;ll stack the chosen metrics (latency and IOPs for this example) on top of the existing values for the VM.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-q2kiB045I8Q/W9OpJ0a-BOI/AAAAAAAAUDQ/tRNlCxoBX1cEWVpoE1U3J5XdUsO-eYBWwCLcBGAs/s1600/Screenshot_2018-10-26-18-51-35.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;675&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;268&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-q2kiB045I8Q/W9OpJ0a-BOI/AAAAAAAAUDQ/tRNlCxoBX1cEWVpoE1U3J5XdUsO-eYBWwCLcBGAs/s640/Screenshot_2018-10-26-18-51-35.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;You can see from the data above that there is a pretty good chance that increased I/O on the VMware datastore caused the VM latency to increase.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;In this particular case, the SnapMirror schedule for this volume starts at 12:00AM, so this behavior is expected, but it serves to illustrate how useful the data can be for troubleshooting.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;If you notice down in the lower-right, there is a section called &amp;quot;Greedy&amp;quot; - these are resources that are reporting higher-than-normal amounts of IOPs and may be impacting other workloads. It&amp;#39;s not shown in the picture, but there is also a &amp;quot;Degraded&amp;quot; section if a troublesome workload is impacting other workloads negatively.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;It&amp;#39;s pretty cool how you can layer all this data from multiple systems collected by Cloud Insights together and use it for root cause analysis and troubleshooting with just a few clicks.&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;This concludes the series on Cloud Insights, but please don&amp;#39;t think that what I&amp;#39;ve covered here is the sum total of what Cloud Insights has to offer - it does SO MUCH more for public cloud monitoring, cost reclamation estimating, VM right-sizing, and more. As you may be aware, Insight 2018 US just wrapped up, where Cloud Insights was officially announced. So if these posts have piqued your interest, head out to cloud.netapp.com and sign up for a free trial of Cloud Insights and see for yourself.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: left;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Thank you for reading!&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&lt;/content&gt;&lt;link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='https://www.blogger.com/feeds/3947691530317823276/posts/default/1046207921995104425'/&gt;&lt;link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='https://www.blogger.com/feeds/3947691530317823276/posts/default/1046207921995104425'/&gt;&lt;link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='https://www.langhq.com/2018/10/netapp-cloud-insights-preview-part-4.html' title='NetApp Cloud Insights Preview, Part 4: Troubleshooting'/&gt;&lt;author&gt;&lt;name&gt;Donny Lang&lt;/name&gt;&lt;uri&gt;http://www.blogger.com/profile/04332684287885880604&lt;/uri&gt;&lt;email&gt;<span class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="345a5b465144584d7456585b535351461a575b59">[email&#160;protected]</span>&lt;/email&gt;&lt;gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='32' src='//1.bp.blogspot.com/-JafglNogKoE/WsfNRWPGLRI/AAAAAAAAOwA/ct7A0f4IRrMkD4AQSqkjb4FXdWMmsSSYgCK4BGAYYCw/s49/2018-04-06%2B14_39_55-Donny%2BLang%2B%2528%2540DonnyLang1%2529%2B_%2BTwitter.png'/&gt;&lt;/author&gt;&lt;media:thumbnail xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/" url="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rfD0KJC_ihc/W9OitJl85jI/AAAAAAAAUC4/uzyp2XPcMOAvGIN3CcRup90FZCwxdUiIQCLcBGAs/s72-c/Screenshot_2018-10-26-16-35-46.jpg" height="72" width="72"/&gt;&lt;/entry&gt;&lt;entry&gt;&lt;id&gt;tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-3947691530317823276.post-5214003518482800402&lt;/id&gt;&lt;published&gt;2018-10-18T11:22:00.000-07:00&lt;/published&gt;&lt;updated&gt;2018-10-18T11:42:58.398-07:00&lt;/updated&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Blogtober"/&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Blogtober2018"/&gt;&lt;category scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="NetApp"/&gt;&lt;title type='text'&gt;NetApp Cloud Insights Preview, Part 3: Applications and Dashboards&lt;/title&gt;&lt;content type='html'&gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-XZ7IeV890aY/W8iWsJlLrTI/AAAAAAAATro/xqt7ShHgwewy5h4v_qi2X8KyC0Co-X82gCLcBGAs/s1600/post-title-image.png&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;208&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;367&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;360&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-XZ7IeV890aY/W8iWsJlLrTI/AAAAAAAATro/xqt7ShHgwewy5h4v_qi2X8KyC0Co-X82gCLcBGAs/s640/post-title-image.png&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;Welcome to Part 3 of my blog series on NetApp Cloud Insights. In previous posts (see &amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://www.langhq.com/2018/09/netapp-cloud-insights-preview-part-1.html&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Part 1&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; and P&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://www.langhq.com/2018/10/netapp-cloud-insights-preview-part-2.html&amp;quot;&amp;gt;art 2&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; here) I&amp;#39;ve covered getting the Acquisition Unit installed and Data Collectors set up. From there, we saw how you can begin to operationalize the collected data via queries, annotations and performance policies.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;In this post, I&amp;#39;ll be covering Applications and Dashboards - what they are, why you might want to use them, and also an example of creating simple versions of each.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Applications&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;Applications within Cloud Insight are a method by which you can group different objects together as they relate to business applications within your organization. For example, if you have a group of VMs that are part of your Exchange environment, you can group them together so that their data can be viewed cohesively. Even cooler though, is that you can group different object types together as well, not just VMs - Applications can be associated with VMs, hypervisor hosts, storage volumes, and more.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;For our example, I&amp;#39;ll select a group of Exchange VMs and associate them with an Application within Cloud Insights.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;1. Start by clicking on &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Manage&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt; on the left-hand navigation bar and then selecting &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Applications&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt; from the pop-out menu.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-klRE2H1LG0k/W8igpRWyT5I/AAAAAAAATsA/0MJSsoF00KA12PNmezVJT0rRpTZhU3CnwCLcBGAs/s1600/2018_10_18_10_01_53_Cloud_Insights.jpg&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;148&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;452&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;208&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-klRE2H1LG0k/W8igpRWyT5I/AAAAAAAATsA/0MJSsoF00KA12PNmezVJT0rRpTZhU3CnwCLcBGAs/s640/2018_10_18_10_01_53_Cloud_Insights.jpg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;640&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;2. From there, click on the&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;amp;nbsp;+ Application &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;button in the upper right-hand corner of the screen. The Add Application window is displayed.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;3. Put&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Prod Exchange &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;into the &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Name &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;dialog box and set the Priority to &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;High. &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;i&amp;gt;(Note: You can use Application Priorities for Queries and Dashboards to report on Applications of varying importance to your environment). &amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;Click &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Save &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;and your Application will be created.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;4. From here, you can search (via the magnifying glass in the far upper right for your Exchange objects. On the summary page, there is a drop-down to select an Application association.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GUKZ53p521w/W8jO-16K8BI/AAAAAAAATtM/bXt115OJEY8ejx37hRKCY3sCaNrvCTIhwCLcBGAs/s1600/2018_10_18_11_21_03_Program_Manager.png&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;222&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;507&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GUKZ53p521w/W8jO-16K8BI/AAAAAAAATtM/bXt115OJEY8ejx37hRKCY3sCaNrvCTIhwCLcBGAs/s1600/2018_10_18_11_21_03_Program_Manager.png&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;On the upper right, you&amp;#39;ll see an &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Application(s) &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;drop-down menu. If you drop that menu down, you are able to select the Prod Exchange application that we created earlier. Remember, you can add different resources, so if you have storage volumes for Exchange, you can add them to the Application and reference them in Queries and Dashboards.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Dashboards&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;I&amp;#39;m guessing most people are at least somewhat familiar with dashboards as they pertain to infrastructure monitoring. If not, they are an extremely flexible way to visually display the data collected by Cloud Insights to suit a variety of use cases and/or organizational levels.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;The wonderful folks I&amp;#39;ve been working with during my private preview have been kind enough to furnish me with some default dashboards that help illustrate how useful Dashboards can be at communicating important information. Here is an example of one that shows NetApp FlexVol latency information:&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WtfARe7odYA/W8jFbpXux7I/AAAAAAAATs0/q3iHQ1KHuy8lS-xb18joS-_ujDx97X4LQCLcBGAs/s1600/2018_10_18_12_36_45_Cloud_Insights.png&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;863&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1600&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WtfARe7odYA/W8jFbpXux7I/AAAAAAAATs0/q3iHQ1KHuy8lS-xb18joS-_ujDx97X4LQCLcBGAs/s1600/2018_10_18_12_36_45_Cloud_Insights.png&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;There are several Dashboards that are aimed at storage people and also a few that are more geared towards VMware admins. There&amp;#39;s even a default one that will show you all of the objects that are violating your configured Performance Policies, which I thought was super useful.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;However, the real power comes from the ability to add Dashboard Widgets to show information that is relevant to the specific resources you have running in your environment. For example, maybe you want to have a dashboard that shows you how effective your node&amp;#39;s Flash Cache is - there&amp;#39;s a Dashboard Widget for that!&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;1. Start by clicking on &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Dashboards&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;amp;nbsp;on the left-hand navigation bar and then selecting&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;+ New Dashboard&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;amp;nbsp;from the pop-out menu. You&amp;#39;ll be presented with an empty dashboard, don&amp;#39;t forget to give it a name. I&amp;#39;ll call mine &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Storage Cache Overview.&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt; Click on &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Add Widget &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;and select &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Bar Chart &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;for our example. There are many different graphs/charts available though, so pick the one that makes the most sense for the type of data you are attempting to display.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;2. Give your widget a name - I&amp;#39;m going to call mine &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Flash Cache Hit %.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;3. Start building the query for the widget by dropping the object type down to &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Storage Node. &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;Then click the drop-down immediately below that to change the filter to &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Cache Hit Ratio - Total.&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;4. From here, change the Roll Up field from &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;All &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;to &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;HA Partner &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;(&amp;lt;i&amp;gt;side note: I&amp;#39;m not sure why this field is called HA Partner rather than something more descriptive like Node or something like that).&amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;5. Click &amp;lt;b&amp;gt;Save &amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;in the upper right, and your new widget will be displayed on the newly created Dashboard. You can resize it if you wish.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;separator&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;clear: both; text-align: center;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Yass4OMHJHQ/W8jMdVZ8KhI/AAAAAAAATtA/9y90KvPUWswom7LDhNimayo-4nJFK07yQCLcBGAs/s1600/2018_10_18_13_08_50_Cloud_Insights.png&amp;quot; imageanchor=&amp;quot;1&amp;quot; style=&amp;quot;margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;img border=&amp;quot;0&amp;quot; data-original-height=&amp;quot;724&amp;quot; data-original-width=&amp;quot;1570&amp;quot; src=&amp;quot;https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Yass4OMHJHQ/W8jMdVZ8KhI/AAAAAAAATtA/9y90KvPUWswom7LDhNimayo-4nJFK07yQCLcBGAs/s1600/2018_10_18_13_08_50_Cloud_Insights.png&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;As with this and all of my former posts, these examples are barely scratching the surface of what Cloud Insights can do and are here merely to help you understand how the solution might help you solve infrastructure monitoring challenges in your environment.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;Thanks for reading, and keep an eye out for the fourth (and final?) part of my blog series where I cover how Cloud Insights can help with a real-world troubleshooting scenario.&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;b&amp;gt;&amp;lt;br /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/b&amp;gt;&lt;/content&gt;&lt;link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='https://www.blogger.com/feeds/3947691530317823276/posts/default/5214003518482800402'/&gt;&lt;link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' Lang&lt;/name&gt;&lt;uri&gt;http://www.blogger.com/profile/04332684287885880604&lt;/uri&gt;&lt;email&gt;<span class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="ec82839e899c8095ac8e80838b8b899ec28f8381">[email&#160;protected]</span>&lt;/email&gt;&lt;gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='32'
